DataElement.preferredName: Person Prior Mitomycin C Nitrosourea Compound Exclusion Criteria Ind-3b
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable related to prior methylazirinopyrroloindoledione antineoplastic antibiotic isolated from the bacterium Streptomyces caespitosus and other Streptomyces bacterial species as exclusion criteria that restricts entrance or bars participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Prior Mitomycin C Nitrosourea Compound Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to prior methylazirinopyrroloindoledione antineoplastic antibiotic isolated from the bacterium Streptomyces caespitosus and other Streptomyces bacterial species as exclusion criteria that restricts entrance or bars participation in a clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Prior Mitomycin C Nitrosourea Compound Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A methylazirinopyrroloindoledione antineoplastic antibiotic isolated from the bacterium Streptomyces caespitosus and other Streptomyces bacterial species.  Bioreduced mitomycin C generates oxygen radicals, alkylates DNA, and produces interstrand DNA cross-links, thereby inhibiting DNA synthesis.  Preferentially toxic to hypoxic cells, mitomycin C also inhibits RNA and protein synthesis at high concentrations. (NCI04):A group of anticancer drugs that can cross the blood-brain barrier. Carmustine (BCNU) and lomustine (CCNU) are nitrosoureas.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: A methylazirinopyrroloindoledione antineoplastic antibiotic isolated from the bacterium Streptomyces caespitosus and other Streptomyces bacterial species.  Bioreduced mitomycin C generates oxygen radicals, alkylates DNA, and produces interstrand DNA cross-links, thereby inhibiting DNA synthesis.  Preferentially toxic to hypoxic cells, mitomycin C also inhibits RNA and protein synthesis at high concentrations. (NCI04)
Any of a class of alkylating agents that contain both a nitroso group and a urea. They are lipophilic and can cross the blood-brain barrier.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
